title: Even Fizz mains won't play Fizz now.
body:
http://www.twitch.tv/fatefalls

He doesn't even want to play him now it seems, even going AD Fizz due to these changes. Please revert, he doesn't even feel like an assassin anymore, he NEEDS to use E in order to burst with ult combo because his Q is so weak. Leaving him a sitting duck in fights.

Also with the lack of DFG in his build he has to either build weaker items to get his old amount of cdr, or has has to substitute it for power, especially for Mpen boots now just to have decent burst instead of bursting while having CDR.

Feel free to give feedback, but I don't like it. I tested these on live and on PBE, can't say I am satisfied with the changes. Now Fizz is like Zed without and escape plan.


EDIT:

This thread is so old and downvoted; How are people still commenting on it?

Honestly, it's about time they nerfed his burst. Fizz was single handedly the most banned champion at my MMR (regardless of what that is).  The only champion i've ever seen banned more often was Amumu in season 2, which is odd because they haven't really nerfed or buffed him since then?

Doing an analysis on Fizz even though i've never played him.

Leap? Check. Leap up onto pogo stick for temporary invulnerability? Check. Dash further after using that? Check
Application of Grievous Wounds on a relatively frequent basis? Check
A Skillshot ult which follows the person wherever they go and blasts in an AoE? Check

Easy itemization into a Zhonya's, which synergizes perfectly with him as you can easily combo in ability cooldowns so that you have quite the survivability, even though you rarely build into it.

I'm sorry, I don't mean to hate on anyone's champion, but Fizz really had to go. He was *I hate to say it* God-Tier.
FIzz's ban rate was actually relatively low, especially in higher ELO's. Average you could say. Why not nerfed Zed accordingly who 'had' 80% ban rate or something?

Fizz is finally close to being balanced, the reason his win rate dropped so hard is because the skill-less tools are still trying to play him and failing hard. Now they finally have to learn how to play or give up on Fizz. If those who actually know how to play Fizz relatively properly only play him I'm sure his win rate would be over 50.

Then hear me on why this nerf makes me upset in the first place; unlisted.

Fizz is not near as big of a problem as Zed, and unlike Zed, Fizz has had hefty nerfs in the past dealt to his scaling, little compensation, and lichbane has been smacked.

Why nerf Fizz before Zed or Lee? I don't get it.

While Lee and Zed need a nerf first, it is not saying that Fizz doesn't need to be dealt with. It's just Riot is refusing to touch the previous 2.

A near perfect Assassin should be someone like Yi tbh, his kit is very limited but still offers some outplay potential, he has clear and easily exploited weaknesses and at the same time high scaling strength if played right. Whenever he is assassinating someone, he has to be committed, since if he wishes to get out he needs to at least kill 1 guy to even think about surviving or the next target. He dies to anything if got caught as well, same applies to when he is fed unless extremely so.

That's great.

Unlike Fizz who can just try infinitely until he gets a kill, then repeat that until he can 1 shot everybody, that's not fun, at least to anyone who isn't a Lee or Zed playing against you.

He can still do this same thing.

Only if he does commit he has to commit now more than ever, and he can't escape after he gets a kill like Yi, he sits there and takes hits until E is back up.

Yi doesn't always escape when he killed somebody, because he has to run all the way out (or burn a flash), or he can choose to go back in and hopefully kill everybody or make them so scared they run away as he can only heal so much and it's interruptible while being open for grievous wound effects.

Fizz has invulnerability + gapcloser that has a cd going from 16 to 8, and most Fizz uses Q to engage (which is his Another gap closer) while prob use E to secure but he doesn't NEED to because %hp damage, let's not mention his ulti, giant hitbox and strong cc, there is no way his level of commitment is on the same level as any actual assassin that involves any kind of risk in the kit.

Now he has to land his ult, Initiate with W,Q, then E and AA them to death. His Q does no damage. ALso what you say about Yi is entirely true; yes. I think he is the healthiest assassin in the game. But FIzz is a snowball, or he waits till late game usually. Now his late game has been merked and he HAS to find a way to snowball. Unless fed early his Q's damage is useless all game now. :L
Agreed.

An assassin should not be a champ that is capable of 1v5 - under any circumstances, fed or otherwise. For that reason, yi is *not* a healthy assassin, and neither is katarina, nor akali (although she just got nerfed, I dunno how much that hit her). You want a healthy assassin? Talon. Rengar. Kha'zix. Even leblanc, with her endless safety. These guys do their job of killing one target without a ton of incidental damage to the rest of your team. They may have an escape (and if you're leblanc, it might even be tied with zed for best escape in the game), but at least they aren't taking whole teams down. 

They've made fizz much healthier to play against now by making him unable to 1v5. The problem is, it's come at the cost of his ability to do his job of eliminating one target. I'd much rather fight a fed fizz now than a fed... almost any other assassin. Which is saying something, because before, fizz was pretty high up there on my list of fed ~~one-man armies~~ assassins I never want to fight, along with akali, katarina, and yi. 

I would consider fizz more of a split pusher now. He's got strong dueling capabilities and great escape options, but his damage doesn't come down fast enough to be a good assassin in the middle of a group of enemies.

Your definition of assassin makes me scratch my head because you know exact what's up with their kits.

Stealth, strong waveclear, 1 shots where you don't even see coming, full resets, endless mobility. Are these the examples of "healthiness"? Colour me shocked.

Yi has to kill people 1 after another WITH HIS AA unless he is so incredibly fed he kills people by simply pressing 1 of them with alpha strike, if that is the case you only have yourself to blame don't say Yi shouldn't have that power when he is 10+ kills ahead of everyone else. Also you should totally see how fast Yi dies to anything unless ofc again, if he is incredibly fed.

Kat again, doesn't reach her stage if you simply remember to save a single hard cc on her, unless ofc yet again, if she is incredibly fed.

See the trend? If you still don't believe me, try running those 2 into all 1v3, 1v4 and 1v5 situations, as long as it's Silver or higher matches and see what I mean you will be surprised how fast those 2 actually dies as long as there is any cc on the board that isn't a slow.

Akali is simply of bad champion design, her 1 - 5 is bad, just atrocious. But if she somehow gets a lead there is no way to stop her since her entire kits revolves COMPLETELY around gaining higher stats than the enemies which is exactly what buying items get you. So I would agree that Akali is actually a bad example of assassins, however not the other 2.

You're right, you don't usually see many true 1v5s. However, what usually ends up happening is their team presents just enough of a threat that if you focus down the assassin, you die to their team. If you don't, you die to the assassin.

As for the assassins I listed...

Rengar: Very easily countered by grouping. If anyone has a quickly executed CC, he's effectively negated and killed. His strength is in the early and mid game, before people group, by snowballing lanes.
Talon: If he gets *very* fed, he can use his ult as an escape. Often ends up having to use it to secure a kill instead. 
KZ: Damage is low unless target is isolated. He actually tends to build more bruiser as a result, since otherwise he just blows up in teamfights. His ult is annoying, but I honestly don't mind this champ much.
LB: Admittedly, I can't stand this champ. Every *minute*, she gets a free safety net from her passive that makes her inordinately difficult to kill, even when she gets caught. Not dying against her requires staying *very* far outside of her range, but if she isn't using her distortion to damage you, you can usually survive long enough to at least react. Her passive is very poorly designed and should never have been put in the game, but I'd *still* rather play against a fed LB than a fed akali, katarina, or yi. If they're not fed, though, I'd much rather take the yi.

While i think the nerfs hit Fizz quite hard, I am of the belief that most people who mained fizz mained him because of his kit (obviously right?) and his damage. He still has the kit, but he has less damage. He can still 100-0 people, he just needs his ult. He can't just q with his w on, auto you, e, then auto you again and you die. 

I'll admit i disliked fizz as a champion, but i would never turn away from facing a fizz in lane, because although i consider him to be a bullshit champ  he wasn't actually OP or anything. He was just cheap. 

Now he doesn't feel anywhere near as fun to play, and there are better champs that do the same thing as him. You can get more damage AND more CC in other places now. As much as i hate fizz, i cannot be glad there are less people playing him...since he is so easy to kill now lol. BUT i think he should get a bit of his damage back, the little shit is just too weak now.

But that is what Fizz must be. He is the "tidal trickster!" He is supposed to be cheap, and annoying. As a rioter stated 'Fizz is meant to be annoying and slippery so that when you catch he brat the kill is even more satisfying.' I don't know how Fizz could ever have that title if he didn't have such an annoyingly well set up kit. I use Fizz for his kit. But I love Fizz for everything, most perfectly set-up champ I think they have ever created. He fits his lore well, his kit synergies. Why harm something so special?

I'm sorry, but trying to preserve an image of a fictional character as someone who is "supposed to be annoying" at the expense of any and all players who do not play him is bad for a game. The image of fizz does not > people trying to have fun. Cheap isn't fun for anyone else except the fizz. 

Similar to old Teemo shrooms, shit was cheap as hell. Ward the entire map with no limit on shrooms or time limit on each one, and they had twice the AP ratio they do now. Annoying, regardless of champion is not justification for a "cheap" kit.

Remember how they never did anything to actually gave the community what they wanted in order to deter the teemo shroom issue?

They nerfed his AP ratio, ohh, cool! WHo cares!

I'd rather have oracles back instead of just not taking as much damage...

There is a time limit on shrooms now. You upgrade the red trinket to get a short duration oracles. Old shrooms could hit you for 1k  and you'd have to back after one of them mid game, and late game if u were a soft carry. While i still see people picking Teemo to be extremely disrespectful, he is better than he was.

Fizz is still fine. As a Fizz main I was skeptical about it too. I figured out how to do my old trick pre-rework and get first blood by diving right on them once u reach level 3 or 4. His rework is better as he can get a kill at level 6 as long as it lands. People just wish either he didn't have E or that his Q did damage again. Though his Q does no damage, his E and R make up for it and his W that people are complaining about was nerfed. It used to be the 4%-8% missing health as the passive and not the active so Fizz has to have mana in order to do it which he is very hungry of early and late game. Just learn how to go Fizz top if you want a safe route out as top is easier as Fizz than mid now.

But that's not good!!!

Yes, he can do his old burst IF his Fizz lands. It 90% of the time goes right through em' because League hit boxes. But you also HAVE to use E now for damage because his Q does absolutely NO damage. You are a sitting duck for 8-16 secs (with no cd) once you use it. This is basically death row in League. 

Champs like Kha are still viable like this because they have resets after kills. Fizz has to wait stuff out now. 8-16 seconds that the fish is completely defenseless.

You shouldn't have to rely on your most defensive ability for damage when they rest of your kit does nothing while it is down.

A champ who can put out damage without taking any in return (by timing his E correctly) should not be able to freely kill champions of equal or higher level without his ult. Moving his damage to his ult changes it so that Fizz has to work like other Assassins like Talon and Zed where they have very high kill potential when their ult is up, and much lower when it is down. These champs are not going to 100-0 your carry and then get out free literally every second of the game. Only when their ult is up, and to a lot of people even that is too often.

Zed is exactly this.

Talon has issues.

Fizz was healthy before, maybe needing some CDR tunage on his E to keep him from spamming it so much.

I honestly don't know what they will do about Talon, I love that guy as well!

I currently have no issue with Talon. His silence is now a slow so there is actually counterplay (something the Fizz E doesn't have). 

If i had been reworking fizz i'd of done 1 of 2 things. 
1: 
Lower Q damage, Keep w, change E completely to something that just avoids CC but does not make him untagetable, add a bit of damage and adjust hitbox of ult. 

(if i was changing him from where he is RIGHT NOW then ->)2: 
Raise Q damage, lower W damage, Double E cd, keep Ult with the DFG-ish effect.

You can check my ranked games with Fizz. I'm in Gold, not Silver or Bronze and it's still working juuuuuust fine. Fizz is required to use his R early on to kill, level his E and land it properly for actual damage, then follow up with a W+AA+Q. You also have to actually rush a Lichbane instead of throwing your R and a DFG and laughing as the person is instagibbed.

And you like playing against Zed?

Wow, its so ennoying how people without any idea of that champion are talking like they should be playing LCS with Fizz. I scrolled down the Discussion and like 90 per cent of the people are just talking without any understanding of the game or a group setup (pro. and con. fizz changes).
I play Fizz main since good 2-3 years now and from my point of view, champions like Fizz, Akali and Kassadin got killed by riot (in higher elo) for the sake of casual player. They are the sacrifice for keeping the game easy enough that bronze/silver solo queue wont rent 2 much about assasins. 

My argue-points:
-First off, we have to get something straight: I am talking about ap-assassin-fizz. He can offer mainly glasscanon-, solo target dmg and re-positioning -> assassin-characteristics. He is not an carry with reliable dps or a bruiser with much disruption/control.

-Did u guys ever asked urself why fizz wasnt played in championpools of high elo player ever? Its because he was midtier regarding winning/ending 5v5-Teamgames in every patch until probably the now patched AS-bruiser fizz-changes and thats a fact (go watch lcs and high-elo-stream recordings if u dont believe me). Fizzes chances to carry the game as an melee ap-assassin gets lowered every minute after lvl 6, because he has to get ahead to be relevant in lategame and end the game before maxing items. (Team 5v5 has longer avarage games then solo because of lower solo carry potential)

-So what about solo-ranked? The problem with solo ranked is the lack of teamplay and communication. I played almost every elo with different accounts in euw now and i have to say that playing assasins is OP in bronze/silver, just because the role of an assasins want fullfill is so easy 2 achieve against unorganised opponents. But if u climb up the elo-ladder facing better organised teams, who wont let 1v1 fighting against other carries, will crush you as assasins. Thats why assassins have to get ahead in early-mid game for carrying and without dfg this isnt as easy as it sounds in higher elo(plat/dia). 
-> Regarding the 2 ONLY PERIODS, some month before (as ap-assassin) and some weeks after dfg-remove-patch (as AS-Bruiser), he actually was top-tier in solo-ranked ONLY in Bronze/Silver, like almost every assassin normally is(higher solo-snowball-potential).

-About the "broken" mechanic of fizz e -> Its the only ability who can make fizz work as an late assasin 1 w-q combo never ever kills an adc (even without any armor/mr/hp built), thats why he NEEDS that invulnarability, he has no veigar/syndra ult in his kit. His e doesnt make him broken, he makes him competitive against other assasins in a tf-scenario. He has to be able to kill a carry, like a carry has to be able to kill a bruiser and a bruiser to kill an assasin, thats how the game is built up. If he cant be invulnerable he would die against a carry just focusing him down after his w-q burst.

-Conclusion: Is it healthy to nerf assassins so much, that bronze/silver can handle them? -> for the game targeting casual-gamer, it is (this is, what i suspect, are riots plans for LOL).
...BUT...
Is it healthy for a balanced moba including Assassins(aka. anti-carrys) as a role to fullfill? -> NOOOO it is not! 
Riot abviously wants to get the casual-players back from HotS to play more league. And the mainpart of the community in the forums im following want to have a game ranged carrys vs. melee bruisers, without the diversity it has now....

-My suggestion to riot: Try to make ur game special, harder, and with more diversity. Casual games will lose their community much faster..
My suggestion for Fizz: Remove the latest changes about fizz. Taking away the dfg and forcing a morello's in his assassin-build nerfed him enough to be mid-tier assassin. If u think u cant remove anything, probably keep the flashable q.

PS to the forum arguments for keeping fizz: 
-Bann-rates of Fizz in solo-ranked were medium some month before, some weeks after dfg-removal-patch and some weeks after fizz release. The bigger part of the time for fizz as a champion were rare played and banned. (Go watch statistics on op.gg or LolKing before arguing about this.)

-Fizz has no counterplay? lol, my duo partner would screw me over every game if i would play against his leona/janna/morgana... there is so much counterplay against him, every silence, stun, exhaust totally annihalates fizz, while getting focused by a carry. Probably u think there is no counterplay because the supp/bruiser already used all the lockdown on the frontline? -> well nvm u are in the wrong elo my friend.

-For all them carries, who hate these "op" assassins: climb the ladder, they get easier to handle with a team actually playing WITH u! or better go play leona/ali/janna/morg when u face an assassin and lock em down when theyre try to snatch a carry. Its actually easy as that
